RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui doutorado em Economia pela FEA-USP, com perodo Sanduche na University of York - UK. Fez graduao e mestrado em Economia pela Universidade de So Paulo. Professor do Insper desde 2017 onde leciona disciplinas de Microeconometria na graduao em Economia, com nfase em aplicaes de problemas reais que envolvem teoria econmica e anlise emprica. Na ps-graduao, Professor do MBA Executivo em Sade do Insper. Integra grupos de pesquisa nacionais e internacionais como o Health Financing for UHC in Challenging Times (HFACT) e o Ncleo de Sade e Polticas Pblicas do Insper, tendo tambm participado de projetos de pesquisa do Global Health Econometrics and Economics (GHE2), Brazilian Women in Economics (EconomistAs), Centro de Polticas Pblicas (CPP), Insper Data e Instituto de Estudos de Sade Suplementar (IESS). Possui artigos acadmicos nas reas em que atua, tendo publicado em peridicos como a Health Economics, Health Policy and Planning, Economics and Human Biology e BMC Health Services Research. reas de interesse p/ pesquisa: Microeconometria e Avaliao de polticas pblicas, Economia da Sade e Economia do Gnero.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: He holds a Ph.D. in Economics from FEA-USP, with a Sandwich period at the University of York - UK. He completed his undergraduate and master's degrees in Economics at the University of So Paulo. Since 2017, he has been a Professor at Insper, where he teaches Microeconometrics in the undergraduate Economics program, with an emphasis on real-world applications involving economic theory and empirical analysis. In the postgraduate program, he is a Professor in the Executive MBA in Health at Insper. He is involved in national and international research groups, such as the Health Financing for UHC in Challenging Times (HFACT) and Ncleo de Sade e Polticas Pblicas - Insper, and has also participated in research projects with Global Health Econometrics and Economics (GHE2), Brazilian Women in Economics (EconomistAs), Center for Public Policy (CPP), Insper Data, and Institute of Supplementary Health Studies (IESS). He has academic articles in the areas he works, having been published in journals such as Health Economics, Health Policy and Planning, Economics and Human Biology, and BMC Health Services Research. Research interests: Microeconometrics and Policy Evaluation, Health Economics, Economics of Gender.

GRADUACAO.NOME-AGENCIA: Fundao de Amparo Pesquisa do Estado de So Paulo

DOUTORADO.NOME-AGENCIA: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientfico e Tecnolgico
DOUTORADO.NOME-INSTITUICAO-OUTRA-DOUT: Centre for Health Economics, University of York

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Assessment of impacts and cost-effectiveness from community-based health interventions in Brazil
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The project aims to perform an assessment of costs and impacts in health outcomes related to expansion in coverage of Brazilian primary health care due to inception of the largest community-based health programme in Brazil, the Family Health Programme (PSF). The analysis will be carried out in two dimensions: 1) PSF impacts on health outcomes at the municipal and individual levels, especially regarding chronic non-communicable diseases; 2) its cost-effectiveness with respect to public funding at the national and subnational levels.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Global Health Research Unit on Health Financing for Universal Health Coverage in challenging times (HFACT): leaving no-one behind
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The long-term aim of this Unit project is the strengthening of capacity in Brazil, India, Indonesia and South Africa to adapt health financing policies and programmes for resilient, equitable and sustained progress towards UHC. We place particular emphasis on the poor and left-behind populations in the four large middle-income countries, since these countries are characterised by high levels of economic and health inequalities. The Unit pursues four objectives to achieve the overall aim: 1) Produce policy-relevant, actionable research, applying and developing innovative health economics methods to address major health financing challenges that impede UHC progress. 2) Strengthen and expand research capability in using health economics/financing for decision-making in partner countries among both academic researchers and policy practitioners (including via south-south knowledge exchange network). 3) Strengthen and develop stakeholder coalitions with policymakers, civil society partners and the public in partner countries to improve the relevance and quality of policy making in health financing, and foster a greater use of health economic evidence in decision-making. 4) Engage with international organisations / stakeholders / policymakers (e.g. WHO, PAHO, the World Bank, bilateral donors) to share findings, foster global uptake and influence global UHC policies.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: BRAVE: Covid-19, social distancing and violence against women in Brazil
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Domestic violence against women is a major issue in Brazil and tends to disproportionally affect those from disadvantaged backgrounds. Pandemic social distancing measures have been linked to an increase in domestic abuse globally. This research seeks to understand how these measures affect domestic violence against women in Brazilian cities and to assess the resulting costs to victims and society. It will also examine how public policies in Brazil aimed at mitigating the negative consequences of social distancing influence domestic violence, and how these policies could be refined to better protect vulnerable women.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Faculdade de Economia Administrao e Contabilidade

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Envelhecimento da populao brasileira e seus efeitos nas despesas com planos de sade: Perspectivas de longo prazo
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O rpido envelhecimento da populao brasileira tem implicaes significativas para o setor de seguros sade privado. Com as mudanas demogrficas e o aumento da expectativa de vida, as operadoras de planos de sade privados precisam compreender os perfis atuais e futuros dos usurios. Sabe-se, por exemplo, que os custos relacionados ao cuidado com idosos representam uma parcela significativa das despesas dos planos de sade privados. O relatrio, escrito em parceria com o Instituto de Estudos de Sade Suplementar (IESS), tem como primeiro objetivo da pesquisa entender o perfil dos indivduos que possuem um plano de sade privado. Um segundo objetivo deste estudo consiste em entender como a dinmica de envelhecimento da populao brasileira de longo prazo afetar a busca por cobertura privada de sade e suas respectivas despesas com planos de sade. As projees de longo prazo da proporo de idosos, das despesas assistenciais por beneficirios, das receitas de contraprestaes e do PIB per capita contribuem para traar o perfil de algumas das principais variveis que influenciam o mercado de planos de sade no Brasil. Alm disso, as simulaes aqui realizadas ajudam a entender como se d o comportamento das despesas assistenciais com idosos e a projetar a cobertura prevista de plano de sade.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Insper Instituto de Ensino e Pesquisa

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Background familiar e a Percepo feminina sobre a violncia domstica usando os microdados da World Values Survey
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O principal objetivo deste estudo entender a influncia de fatores socioeconmicos e familiares na aceitao de violncia contra a mulher ao redor do mundo. Estudo desenvolvido com trs alunos de graduao do Insper Data. Neste estudo, os alunos leram trabalhos tericos e empricos sobre violncia domstica. A investigao tambm consistiu em trabalhar com os microdados da World Values Survey (WVS), e realizar um relatrio com os resultados encontrados.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-COMPLETO: Maria Luisa Monteiro Seixo de Brito

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Bolsa Famlia e a Permanncia na escola
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Pesquisa desenvolvida no Centro de Polticas Pblicas (CPP) do Insper para entender como o Bolsa Famlia afeta a entrada, a permanncia e a mudana de alunos nas escolas. Utilizando os microdados do Censo Escolar, acompanhamos os alunos de escolas pblicas ao longo do tempo e investigamos a influncia da cobertura municipal do Bolsa Famlia na permanncia na escola.
